t: Send*pn the lamb to the ruler of the land, from*ln Sela, by way of the desert, to*ld the mount of the daughter of Zion.
Like*ln fleeing birds, like*ld a scattered nest, so*ln are the daughters of Moab at*ld the fords of the Arnon.
“Give*pn counsel; grant*ld justice; make*ln your shade like night at*ld the height of noon; shelter*ln the outcasts; do*ld not reveal the fugitive;

let*ln the outcasts of Moab sojourn*ld among you; be*ln a shelter to them from*ld the destroyer. When*ln the oppressor is no more, and*ld destruction has ceased, and*ln he who tramples underfoot has vanished from the land,
then*ln a throne will be established in steadfast love, and*ld on it will sit in faithfulness in*ld the tent of David one*ln who judges and seeks justice and*ld is swift to do righteousness.”
We*pn have heard of the pride of Moab— how*ld proud he is!— of*ln his arrogance, his pride, and his insolence; in*ld his idle boasting he is not right.
Therefore*ln let Moab wail for Moab, let*ld everyone wail. Mourn,*ln utterly stricken, for*ld the raisin cakes of Kir-hareseth.

For*pn the fields of Heshbon languish, and*ld the vine of Sibmah; the*ln lords of the nations have*ld struck down its branches, which*ln reached to Jazer and*ld strayed to the desert; its*ln shoots spread abroad and*ld passed over the sea.

Therefore*ln I weep with the weeping of Jazer for*ld the vine of Sibmah; I*ln drench you with my tears, O*ld Heshbon and Elealeh; for*ln over your summer fruit and your harvest the*ld shout has ceased.

And*ln joy and gladness are taken away from the fruitful field, and*ln in the vineyards no songs are sung, no*ld cheers are raised; no*ln treader treads out wine in the presses; I*ld have put an end to the shouting.
Therefore*ln my inner parts moan like a lyre for Moab, and*ld my inmost self for Kir-hareseth.
And*p when Moab presents himself, when he wearies himself on the high place, when he comes to his sanctuary to pray, he will not prevail.
This*p is the word that the Lord*s spoke concerning Moab in the past.

But now the Lord*s has spoken, saying, “In three years, like the years of a hired worker, the glory of Moab will be brought into contempt, in spite of all his great multitude, and those who remain will be very few and feeble.”
